description: '''Gumbe''', also ''goombay'' or ''gumbay'', is a [[West Africa]]n style of music found in countries such as [[Sierra Leone]] and [[Guinea-Bissau]]. Sierra Leonean gumbe music is indigenous to the [[Sierra Leone Creole people|Sierra Leone Krio people]] and was derived from the [[Jamaican Maroon]] ancestors of the Krio people. Krio musicians such as [[Ebenezer Calendar]] and [[Dr Oloh]] popularized gumbe music in Sierra Leone and in other West African locales.
